# Treaty of Novgorod (1537)

Treaty of Novgorod}}
The Treaty of Novgorod, signed in 1537 between the Grand Principality of Moscow and the Kingdom of Sweden, was a truce set to expire in 60 years. The truce lasted until the outbreak of the Russo-Swedish War (1554â€“1557), which was ended by the Treaty of Novgorod (1557), in a truce set likewise to expire in 1597.
